intro: Linanthus veatchii, commonly known as Veatch's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This annual plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus veatchii is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils.
